results.title: Federal Register Printing Savings Act of 2017
results.short_title: Federal Register Printing Savings Act of 2017
results.committees: Senate Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs Committee
results.latest_major_action: Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.
results.summary: (This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary has been expanded because action occurred on the measure.) Federal Register Printing Savings Act of 2017 (Sec. 2) This bill bars the Government Publishing Office from furnishing a printed copy of the Federal Register without charge to any Member of Congress or any other office of the United States during a year unless:  the Member or office requests a printed copy of a specific issue of the Federal Register; or  during that year or the previous year, the Member or office requested a subscription to printed copies of the Federal Register for that year.

actions.description: Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote. (text: CR H4267)
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 195.
Considered under suspension of the rules. (consideration: CR H4267-4268)
Mr. Russell moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 78.
Reported by the Committee on Oversight and Government Reform. H. Rept. 115-128, Part I.
Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Referred to House Oversight and Government Reform
